Package org.jlab.coda.jevio

Class SegmentHeader

java.lang.Object
org.jlab.coda.jevio.BaseStructureHeader
org.jlab.coda.jevio.SegmentHeader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, IEvioWriter
public final class SegmentHeader extends BaseStructureHeader
This the the header for an evio segment structure (EvioSegment). It does not contain the raw data, just the header.
Author:
heddle

    • getDataLength

      public int getDataLength()
      Get the length of the structure's data in 32 bit ints (not counting the header words).
      Specified by:
      getDataLength in class BaseStructureHeader
      Returns:
      Get the length of the structure's data in 32 bit ints (not counting the header words).

    • getHeaderLength

      public int getHeaderLength()
      Get the length of the structure's header in ints. This includes the first header word itself (which contains the length) and in the case of banks, it also includes the second header word.
      Specified by:
      getHeaderLength in class BaseStructureHeader
      Returns:
      Get the length of the structure's header in ints.

    • toArray

      protected void toArray(byte[] bArray, int offset, ByteOrder order)
      Write myself out as a byte array of evio format data into the given byte array in the specified byte order.
      Specified by:
      toArray in class BaseStructureHeader
      Parameters:
      bArray - array into which evio data is written (destination).
      offset - offset into bArray at which to write.
      order - byte order in which to write the data.

    • toString

    • write

      public int write(ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
      Write myself out a byte buffer. This write is relative--i.e., it uses the current position of the buffer.
      Parameters:
      byteBuffer - the byteBuffer to write to.
      Returns:
      the number of bytes written, which for a SegmentHeader is 4.
